intro: Craterostigma boranense, commonly known as the African rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves that help it conserve water. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often growing in harsh, semi-desert environments. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
